tool.name: Convert BAM to BigWig
tool.command: bedtools genomecov -bg -split -ibam '$input1' | LC_COLLATE=C sort -k1,1 -k2,2n > temp.bg && #if $hist_or_builtin.genosel == "indexed": bedGraphToBigWig temp.bg '$chromInfo' '$output' #else: bedGraphToBigWig temp.bg '$chromfile' '$output' #end if

param.name: genosel
param.label: bam aligned to reference genome source
param.help: Is the bam mapped to a built-in reference or a genome from your history with a chromosome lengths file?
param.option: Input data was made with a built-in genome or already has a custom genome dbkey
Input data mapped on a genome from the current history. The chromosome lengths file is also in the history

param.name: chromfile
param.label: Chromosome length file
param.help: A file of sequence lengths for the history reference is required to make a bigwig. Compute sequence length tool can make these from fasta files
